required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Delivery Room Practice Change Following the Initiation of the NICHD SUPPORT Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Delivery Room Practice Change Following the Initiation of the NICHD SUPPORT Trial

collaborator.agency: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center

clinical_study.source: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center

brief_summary.textblock:
This study was designed to analyze whether initiation of the NICHD Neonatal Research Network SUPPORT trial was followed by a change in frequency of endotracheal intubation the delivery room in non-participants and whether these changes were associated with changes in management and outcomes.
The investigators hypothesized that the investigators would observe following the initiation of the SUPPORT trial a 33% reduction in the rate of intubation in the delivery room among non-participants preterm infants at Parkland Memorial Hospital.

primary_outcome.measure: Endotracheal intubation in the delivery room
primary_outcome.description: Frequency of endotracheal intubation in the delivery room

secondary_outcome.measure: Continuous positive airway pressure in the delivery room
secondary_outcome.description: Frequency of continuous positive airway pressure in the delivery room

secondary_outcome.measure: Endotracheal intubation in the first four hours after admission
secondary_outcome.description: Frequency of endotracheal intubation in the first fours after admission to the neonatal intensive care unit

secondary_outcome.measure: Endotracheal intubation until four hours after admission
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Between birth and 4 hours after admission
secondary_outcome.description: Frequency of endotracheal intubation between birth and four hours after admission in the neonatal intensive care unit

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Any time between birth and 2 days of age
secondary_outcome.description: Frequency of admninistration of surfactant any time between birth and 2 days of age

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Any time before discharge or transfer or 12 months of age (whichever comes first)
secondary_outcome.description: Pneumothorax any time before discharge or transfer or 12 months of age (whichever comes first)
Chronic changes on chest radiograph and oxygen requirement (fractional inspiratory concentration of oxygen greater than 0.21) for at least 28 days

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Any time before discharge or transfer or 12 months of age (whichever comes first)
secondary_outcome.description: Necrotizing enterocolitis (at least stage II, modified Bell's classification) any time before discharge or transfer or 12 months of age (whichever comes first)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until discharge or transfer or 12 months of age (whichever comes first)
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of invasive mechanical ventilation until discharge or transfer or or 12 months of age (whichever comes first)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until discharge or transfer or 12 months of age (whichever comes first)
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum inspiratory oxygen concentration until discharge or transfer or 12 months of age (whichever comes first)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until discharge or transfer or 12 months of age (whichever comes first)
secondary_outcome.description: Severe retinopathy of prematurity (at least stage III, international classification) until discharge or transfer or 12 months of age (whichever comes first)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until discharge or transfer or 12 months of age (whichever comes first)
secondary_outcome.description: Mortality until discharge or transfer or 12 months of age (whichever comes first)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Any time before discharge or transfer or 12 months of age (whichever comes first)
secondary_outcome.description: Cystic periventricular leukomalacia or grade III or IV intraventricular/ periventricular hemorrhage detected by ultrasonogram any time before discharge or transfer or 12 months of age (whichever comes first)

study_pop.textblock: All babies born at Parkland Memorial Hospital with gestational age at least 24 weeks and less than 35 weeks between 01/2003 and 06/2010

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All babies born at Parkland Memorial Hospital with gestational age at least 24 weeks and less than 35 weeks between 01/2003 and 06/2010
Exclusion Criteria:
- Infants receiving comfort care
- Those with major congenital anomalies
- Those enrolled in the SUPPORT trial

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center
